title: The Deleted Client Database
setting: Summit Legal Associates, IT office, Friday 8 AM
premise: The firm's entire client contact database was deleted from the shared server at 9:42 PM Thursday. Backups exist, but restoring them will take two days and cost thousands.

suspects.name: Nora Briggs
suspects.motive: Being let go at the end of the month and bitter about it
suspects.alibi: I left the office at 6 PM and went to my book club meeting at the Cedar Park Library. We discussed our book from 7 to 9 PM. Six other members were there.

suspects.name: Dev Kapoor
suspects.motive: In a contract dispute with the firm over unpaid invoices
suspects.alibi: I was at home working on another client's project all evening. I had a video call with that client from 8 PM to 9:30 PM. The call log is on my account.

suspects.name: Paula Richter
suspects.motive: Wanted to destroy records of a client she improperly billed
suspects.alibi: I was at a charity gala at the Riverside Hotel from 7 PM until midnight. I gave a speech at 8:30 PM. There are photos and a program listing me.

suspects.name: Eli Thornton
suspects.motive: Passed over for a promotion to office manager that he applied for twice
suspects.alibi: I stayed late to organize case files until about 9 PM. Then I walked to Sal's Diner next door and had dinner until around 10 PM. The waitress knows me.

clues.title: Server Access Log
clues.content: The deletion was executed using admin credentials that only Dev and the IT director have access to. The IT director has been on vacation in Europe all week.

clues.title: Video Call Verification
clues.content: Dev's client confirmed the video call happened from 8 to 9:30 PM, but noted Dev appeared to be at an office, not at home — there were fluorescent lights and a whiteboard behind him.

clues.title: VPN Connection Records
clues.content: The deletion was done from inside the office network, not remotely. The server does not allow remote admin access — it must be done from a terminal on-site.

hints.text: Think about where each suspect was physically located around 9:42 PM Thursday.
If someone was on a video call, what does their background reveal about their actual location?
